sources.title: Red Planet Mars
sources.description: Title: Red Planet Mars Summary: An American scientist is able to contact and communicate with Mars with shattering political, economic, and spiritual repercussions. Directed by: Harry Horner Actors: Peter Graves, Andrea King, Herbert Berghof Production Company: Melaby Pictures Corp. Release Date: 15 May 1952 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 An American scientist contacts Mars by radio and receives information that Mars is a utopia and that Earth's people can be saved if they return to the worship of God. Revolution sweeps the Earth, including the Soviet Union. But there remains doubt about the messages being genuine, as an ex-Nazi claims he was duping the Americans.

metadata.Plot: An American scientist contacts Mars by radio and receives information that Mars is a utopia and that Earth's people can be saved if they return to the worship of God. Revolution sweeps the Earth, including the Soviet Union. But there remains doubt about the messages being genuine, as an ex-Nazi claims he was duping the Americans.
metadata.Writer: John L. Balderston, Anthony Veiller, John Hoare
metadata.Actors: Peter Graves, Andrea King, Herbert Berghof
